alert.note: Alert for Sumner (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 25 at 7:53AM CDT until May 25 at 11:58PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kansas... Chikaskia River near Corbin affecting Sumner County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Chikaskia River near Corbin. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Left bank overflows extend out to about 100 yards. A low water bridge on South Sumner Road, 3 miles downstream from gage site or 2 miles southwest of Corbin, floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:46 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 11.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this morning and continue falling to 3.3 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Chikaskia River Corbin 10.0 11.7 Wed 7 am CDT 7.4 4.3 3.5 &&
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
